result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan S Buchert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DNA to be paid along with fine on payment plan.
Case 14CM1673 was dismissed and read into: 15CM737.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

Defendant Bryan S Buchert in court with attorney Kevin G Keane.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count 1 and count 2 is dimissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence:

Fine of $505.00
Domestic Abuse Surcharge $100.00
DNA Surcharge $200.00
Defendant to pay $25.00 a month commencing 12/01/2015 or alternate of 16 days jail. Court grants 1 day credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-30-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Bryan S Buchert in court with attorney Kevin G Keane.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment to have more time to speak with the state. Defense further stated that this matter will be resolved. Court adjourns for pleas and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.
